website_summaries.verdict: Leak-resistant individual storage containers that are ideal for feeding your baby on the go.
pros: Screw on caps won't pop off
Easy to stack on top of one another
cons: May crack if dropped after they have been in the freezer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - lids fall off and the dollar store sells better ones $1 for 10!!!
customer_reviews.text: The base is a waste of space in the freezer and does not properly hold the containers stable. The lids do not stay on and have opened up and caused messes in my fridge and lunchbox. I found WAY better quality ones at the dollar store (bpa free) - a pack of 10 for $1.
customer_reviews.author: cheario

customer_reviews.title: Convenient for all sorts of things.
customer_reviews.text: I've liked these enough to have twice purchased another set of them. I had in mind a very specific use for these when I first bought them, but I've since discovered they are convenient to use for many things, not all of which are food related. My only carping is that sometimes they stack too loosely or too tightly, a trivial complaint for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Gadfly-in-Residence

customer_reviews.title: These were great for making homemade baby food
customer_reviews.text: These were great for making homemade baby food, you can stack them securely on one another as they will fit on the next jar's lid. The are also good for small snacks like cherrios. My husband and I also use them for salad dressings for our lunches, they make the perfect size. The only thing I didn't like about them is the lid sometimes wouldn't tighten all the way and would come off. They made a mess a few times in the diaper bag because of it, but I ended up just putting the food in a plastic ziploc to ensure food stays safe.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Santizo

customer_reviews.title: Great for making your own baby food.
customer_reviews.text: We got these for storing baby food that we made ourselves. We also got some ice cube trays with lids that were made for storing baby food in the freezer. When we make a batch of baby food, we put most of it in the ice cube trays, and then once frozen transfer the cubes to freezer zip bags. Then we put the rest of it into these jars and put them in the fridge for consumption within the next week. We have also occasionally put these jars in the freezer and they work fine there too. I think our system works pretty well for us and saves us a lot of money on baby food.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Cade

customer_reviews.title: I love them. I have not used the tray yet ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for portion control on Nutrisystem maintenance plan. 4 oz plastic containers with screw tops are difficult to find. I love them. I have not used the tray yet and might not but love the containers for portion control. I am washing them in the dishwasher and use them primarily for rice and beans.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie J. Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these containers to store my homemade baby food for home and travel. So far they have been pretty durable through freezing, refrigeration, and the dishwasher. I do not reheat in the container mainly because my child doesn't eat the full amont yet and I do not want to reheat and cool down the same food product many times. I like the screw on lids because no leaks have occurred despite being knocked around in a diaper bag. Update 9-11-12 I am now reheating in the containers. Reheating has been easy and no worries on staining or morphing the container. I do recommend this particular baby food container to anyone considering making their own food. Durable and useful.
customer_reviews.author: SBC

customer_reviews.title: The Lids dont stay on
customer_reviews.text: The lids don't stay put for the life of me. I mean if you're going to make a cup with a lid have the lid stay on properly. I bought this with the intent of using them for my son's daycare we aren't allowed to bring glass jars anymore. So I happen to come across this wonderful product and read the reviews. and thought I would give it a try. Surprisingly The lids don't stay on snug enough to travel anywhere outside the kitchen. I will be returning them
customer_reviews.author: Baseman

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Great product, perfect size. Very easy to clean and store. Great locking of stacked cups to keep the cups organized.
customer_reviews.author: Amy E Harmon

customer_reviews.title: These have been great! We previously had 4oz containers and we were ...
customer_reviews.text: These have been great! We previously had 4oz containers and we were always running out, or not having enough space in our lunch bags for all the little things we throw together (we don't believe in boring lunches). The 2oz containers have been a perfect fix to our lunch box issue. We have more room, they store better than the other 4oz brand we have and work well in the dish washer!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Easy to plan ahead
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for adult portion control and they’ve worked well so far. I like how the individual cups snap together to make a tower affect. These lids snap on, however, do not stop leaks.
customer_reviews.author: SevenGoats

customer_reviews.title: Love these! We used these to half 4 oz ...
customer_reviews.text: Love these! We used these to half 4 oz Gerber baby food so my son could have a vegetable and fruit while he was little. It is cheaper to buy the 4oz containers of Gerber baby food than the 2oz. Now that my son eats the entire container on food, we use these to carry his snacks in (goldfish, cheeze its, etc). The containers have held up well and wash nicely. They are also BPA free.
customer_reviews.author: JY

customer_reviews.title: Numbers on bottom range from 1-4.
customer_reviews.text: My concern is that the 2 ounce and 4 ounce cups have numbers on the bottom that include 1, 2, 3, and 4. Although they are listed as BPA and phthalate free, I am concerned about the actual composition of these plastic cups.
customer_reviews.author: Lucia

customer_reviews.title: They leak liquid
customer_reviews.text: They might be ok for a gel, but we hoped to be able to take coffee cream in lunch and it leaks right out. Also salad dressing for salads was an objective - if it's vinegar based, it's coming out. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Gould

customer_reviews.title: Good in fridge, NOT good in the freezer.
customer_reviews.text: Even with only 2/3 of the cup full, they pop open when frozen and can't be closed. Some of the lids dont seal properly at all (Some snap shut, some smash shut and some just dont shut.) and if you drop one when its frozen it will shatter. They DO stack if you stack them before freezing, but once frozen you can't stack them together, they just wont snap. And if you force them, again, they shatter. Love the size and idea, but after using them for less than two weeks three of them are broken, half of them wont seal, and Im already shopping for a replacement set. But these are terrific if you just want to refridgerate stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic. I was looking for a replacement for the Baby Bullet freezer tray, but this is so much better as the container themselves can be frozen and even microwaved. The size is so nice, they could be also used for storing craft supplies, sewing supplies, nuts and bolts, and so many other things. The fact that they snap to each other and they tray is also clever.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Many Uses
customer_reviews.text: I used these initially for pureeing baby food. Once that was over, I now use these for snack portion control. They are really convenient and dishwasher safe. Win win.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for School Lunches!
customer_reviews.text: I tried out a bunch of different containers for my daughter's school lunches when she started Kindergarten over a year ago, but she had a really hard time pulling the lids off. A lot of times she was pulling so hard, the contents would spill. I got a set of these and they are perfect. I love that these are twist offs - and easy for a kid to open. I use them every school day and have been running them through the dishwasher for over a year. None of them have had any leaks. I use them primarily for a kid size portion of cottage cheese with a little fruit on top.
customer_reviews.author: SuzSeattle

customer_reviews.title: I love them
customer_reviews.text: I love them. They screw on instead of snap on so I know they’re secure. They also heat and do not stain. The stacking ability is very very useful. It has made my baby food making so easy.
customer_reviews.author: Oleta

customer_reviews.title: Best Storage for homemade Baby Food
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wanted another type of storage containers for the baby food. So I bought her the ones she wanted and then I bought three sets of these for her. From experience I knew these were the best, as I used ice cube trays to freeze her homemade babyfood back in the early 80's. My daughter tried the ones she wanted and absolutely hates them. She loves these to store her homemade baby food in the freezer. They take up less room in her freezer, they are stackable without the tray. They go from the freezer to microwave to the dishwasher! These are not expensive like the rubber ones my daughter wanted. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Suzan Plummer

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have bought bigger
customer_reviews.text: I only used these for about a month. The lids were hard to get on correctly and it was super easy for my daughter to drop then in the floor and the lid pop off. Definitely only expect to be able to freeze one type of baby food at a time as these are small and things like sweet potatoes are huge.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy T

customer_reviews.title: There OK just used gently
customer_reviews.text: I initially like this product because it had screw on lid‘s and I liked how it stored within the tree in the freezer. After purchasing and using for the first time I found out you need to be careful overfilling the containers because the food will push off the lids once frozen but there is an online showing you where to stop feeling to prevent that. Also these containers are not durable and break easily . Be careful with accidental containers falling out of the freezer or the fridge. Overall I would not purchase these containers again.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: We Still Use it and my dauther is already 3 going on 4
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to store my 5 mo. old daughter's homemade food when she was transitioning from breastfeeding to solid foods. I was able to store and then thaw the right amount of food in this little containers without taking too much space in the freezer. As she grew, so did her appetite... but these we've grown with us too. I still use them to serve her nuts, blueberries, raspberries or strawberries (cut into small pieces). The right amount and separately, again without taking too much space :).
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: perfect portion size
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my daughter in law for her baby food preparations. She loves them and says they are the perfect size for a portion of baby food, or, in the case of my older grandchild, snacks for school. The lids fit snugly and they keep food fresh in the freezer - they stack on each other and the tray holds the bottom row in place. These containers will a need for small, neat, vessels for baby/kid food. They work for left overs for toddlers as well - so you can make the veggies one day and serve them several days!
customer_reviews.author: D. wood

customer_reviews.title: Great Containers, very useful
customer_reviews.text: I do not have a baby, but I do have a ferret that needs to be fed a baby food mixture everyday. These containers are great. The screw-on caps really make a water and air-tight seal that I felt was lacking in any containers I tried previously. The two ounce capacity is perfect as well. Its about the volume of two ice cubes. It's great to be able to make food in advance and store it. The containers seem flimsier than I expected but they have held up well to repeated washings in the dishwasher. I do wish they came in other colors besides that green, but thus far thats my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Eztli

customer_reviews.title: Cracked Lids Already CHEAP
customer_reviews.text: I was reading a blog that had this affiliate link to buy these jars, so I bought 2 packs. After making a batch of food and using jars ONE time my lids all have cracks in them. I didn't man handle them, put them in the dishwasher, or put them in the microwave. Just really cheap material I guess. I would just buy the expensive ones. At least they won't be trash after one use.
customer_reviews.author: Maddie Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Not so great...
customer_reviews.text: Good for short-term food storage in fridge but lids pop open when containers stored in freezer. Containers also crack easily if frozen and dropped on floor. I do like the fact that they are BPA free however there are better products out there. I purchased the "Baby Cubes" 2 Oz. Baby Food Storage Containers by Juvenile Solutions which in my opinion are a much better product. They do not contain Phthalates, Bisphenol-A, or PVC, do not crack, freeze much better and are less expensive:
customer_reviews.author: Sparkle Pig

customer_reviews.title: Price is good.  Quality is fair.
customer_reviews.text: I paid $20 for 12 pack of this. I have the baby bullet system but only has 6 cute containers. Compared to the baby bullet containers which are much more expensive, these has poorer quality. Plastic is thinner and squeezable. After 4 months use, one container and one lid cracked in the freezer and one lid broke when I dropped it on the kitchen floor. I guess the price compansates the quality. I do like the screw top but still it is not secured all time, especially upon freezing, the lid comes off the container at times.
customer_reviews.author: Mangoberry

customer_reviews.title: Baby not required
customer_reviews.text: I don't even have a baby. I bought these for the juice I make from lemons and limes (purchased in quantity from my warehouse club)...I juice the fruit and save it in these containers to use for cooking and cocktails. The best thing about these containers is that all the pieces snap together; you can actually transport the whole tray to the freezer without fear of dropping any of the pieces. The caps screw on to preserve the quality of the contents. These are so terrific that I'm ordering a second set.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: The lids snap on easily and quickly and the cups stack well. They fit perfectly into the fridge door, and hold just about a small baby-food jar. They wash well and easily. I would say that one set isn't quite enough for those that make in mass, and I recommend buying at least two. I will say that while I invested in these, and they're nice, they are a bit expensive when ice cube trays stack better, hold just as much, and are way cheaper. I use these for fresh food I make and plan to have used quickly, and freeze food in ice cube trays.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Nicole Steward

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Here are my findings on this product: Pros - Love the screw on lid, doesn't spill if you have to put in purse or diaper bag. - Perfect 2 oz size. I tend to give my son 2 of these in different foods, depending on how hungry he is. - Not flimpsy or thin. - Doesn't get freezer burn on the top like other plastic containers. Cons - If you fill too full the lids pop off in the freezer (just don't fill all the way to the rim and this shouldn't be a problem). Overall, great product! I ordered two 12-pk packages and actually need to buy more.
customer_reviews.author: E. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Nice size
customer_reviews.text: Well made and nice fit. Got rid of the tray, but i can see how that would be good for others.
customer_reviews.author: londongirl

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality
customer_reviews.text: The lids fit inconsistently. Some are tight and some are so loose that they fall off easily.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Smathers

customer_reviews.title: Great containers, however not 100% leak proof.
customer_reviews.text: If you have something real watery it may leak some. For the most part though they are nice.
customer_reviews.author: JDM

customer_reviews.title: Useful!
customer_reviews.text: I use these when I make fresh baby food that I plan to serve while fresh (within 3 days). If I'm thawing food, the freezer tray cubes don't fit inside these containers so I use a baby bowl. These also work great when traveling. We're going on the road for about 2 weeks and these are convenient for mixing/serving jarred baby food since I won't be able to make food on the trip and I still want my son to have more than 1 vegetable or fruit at a time. I just open a few jars, divide them across the containers and we're good to go.
customer_reviews.author: LoganMama

customer_reviews.title: Was not super impressed with these
customer_reviews.text: Was not super impressed with these. The stackability is nice, but the tops do not fit securely. We definitely had some leaks with ours.
customer_reviews.author: DLJ

customer_reviews.title: Super handy!
customer_reviews.text: I don't use these for baby food. I use them for containers in my children's sack lunches. The lids twist off rather than popping off, so they are easy for the kids to open without spilling. I also have the 2 oz size. I've used them for Jell-o, pudding, ranch dip, hummus, peanut butter, mandarin oranges, peaches, Craisins, sunflower seeds, etc. We have not had any leaks or spills so far. They are handy for so many things. The lids lock into the bottom of the container, so you can stack them securely. I think they are a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Historychick

customer_reviews.title: Lids pop off
customer_reviews.text: I gave these away. After going to the trouble of making baby food, I don't want it spilling and leaking everywhere. The little tray idea was a great IDEA, but it takes up so much space in the freezer, its just not practical. The lids don't stay on consistently. Some were great, some weren't. I reused old baby food jars that I washed in the dishwasher to sterilize instead. Avoided the issues of plastic that way, anyway.
customer_reviews.author: J. Becker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for DIPS and DRESSINGS
customer_reviews.text: EXACTLY what I was looking for. We use these containers for our dips, like ranch and honey mustard for my kids lunches. SO far, they haven't leaked. THey are the perfect size for carrying dips.
customer_reviews.author: GA Mom of 4

customer_reviews.title: Best Containers!
customer_reviews.text: When I started researching making my own baby food I got lots of advice, especially about containers. When I saw these I was intrigued and ordered two sets. After using them I ordered two more! I loved the fact I could fill the containers and neatly stack them in the freezer. I don't have to worry about the lids popping off in the diaper bag, or about bags full of "ice cubes" falling out or sticking together. I bought small removal labels to write on the contents and the date. All I have to do is pull a container out and let it defrost. They are easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: L. Velarde

customer_reviews.title: Did not fit our needs.
customer_reviews.text: containers warp in shape sometimes when frozen and break seal. This causes contents to become freezer burnt. The lid only twists about 1 quarter turn. Will try to return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Okay but there are better options for twins
customer_reviews.text: I bought these food containers since we are pureeing large quantities of baby food for my twin 8 month old boys. I like that they are exactly 4 oz each but at about $10 there are more affordable options. I recently bought the Ziploc 2 cup tupperware and for about $4 for a 3 pack this is a much better option for mothers who are feeding more than one baby at a time. You just fill to the 1 cup line of the container and divide the food. Overall all the Fresh and Freeze set it is a decent product- just don't buy the labels that Step Ahead adversite - those are a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: EllainMiami

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Use them to make frozen dog treats. Perfect size . Dog doesn't destroy them. They freeze and wash up well in dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Performed as Promised
customer_reviews.text: I don’t have a baby to use these for, but being mindful of what I eat, these are terrific for portion controlled, take along foods, while I am out and about ....
customer_reviews.author: Karen Dalkin

customer_reviews.title: Great snack size
customer_reviews.text: These are great, they stack on top of each other which is very helpful. I put cheerios in one container, and another snack in another container, stack them on top of each other and place in the diaper bag. It is easy to find them when they are stack together. It is just the right size for cheerios for my little man on a trip. The top locks on and easy to pop on and off. I haven't freezed these yet as I like to use them for snacks in the diaper bag
customer_reviews.author: Carina

customer_reviews.title: Nice sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: These are nice, sturdy, and easy to clean and store. I actually recommend them for more than just baby food. They're great for small portions of things like salad dressing in a child's lunchbox because they don't spill as easily as a lot of other small containers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lids don't fit right
customer_reviews.text: The lids don't stay on very tight and doesn't work well for traveling with a baby. Honestly these got thrown to the back of the cabinet after a few uses since they weren't working for us.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great baby food containers
customer_reviews.text: Loved these little cups. I used them for two kids and they didn't wear out. Unlike most snap cups, these tops screw on so they won't pop off in a diaper bag. Plus they can click together which is really nice for storage. When I made home made baby food I would portion it out in two sets of these and out one in the fridge and one in the freezer. It was perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Kat22183

customer_reviews.title: These are great in lunches.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these to hold condiments and small snacks in our lunches. Very durable. I like the way they stack so they don't take up to much cabinet space.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Girl

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought two sets of these for my daughter. They are very good quality with excellent sealing features. Looks like they will last a long time. With decent pricing and great service from "One Step Ahead", why go anywhere else? I looked at the other brand offered and didn't like the cheap plastic hindges. I was pretty sure they wouldn't last. Besides, it would be quite difficult to lose one of these lids because the bright colors are easily seen.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Behmer

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE These!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used several different baby food stoarge containers and these are the BEST yet! The screw on lids seal nicely, I have never had a leak! They stack up well if they are not frozen when you stack them. Now that my daughter is eating mostly table food, I use these containers for snacks and ice pops. As far as the comments on the containers breaking if they fall from the freezer, I have had many different containers break when falling from the freezer! I don't think I own a breast milk starage bottle that has the whole base unbroken!
customer_reviews.author: Amber C

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. The lids do not stay on, they pop right off even though they claim not to. Drop it and the lid pops right off; over fill a little and then freeze, the lid pops off. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Iommi

customer_reviews.title: Love love love!
customer_reviews.text: I was searching for alternatives to the Baby Bullet system, and found these 2oz containers. These are ingeniously stackable--the bottoms fit into the tops so they won't fall over in the fridge. Plus they are a convenient size and the liquid measurement is right on the side--1oz or 2oz. I got these, the freezer trays, and the H-B Bebe hand blender, all for less than the BB. I love when I discover high-quality products! Thank you Fresh N Freeze.
customer_reviews.author: Pookapuff

customer_reviews.title: Great for freezing home made baby food
customer_reviews.text: We have been using these for the past few months with our 6 month old. They work great for freezing baby food and warming it up. We have had no issues with cracks, warping etc. My wife loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Sam24and48

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for measuring & storing of foods after Bariatric surgery. Thank You just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Margie L

customer_reviews.title: Freezer system
customer_reviews.text: I love this freezer storage system. I am going to purchase two more. They are the perfect size. I prepare all my baby's food at once for the week and then I just pop it into these containers and store in the freezer. The tops screw on and off which is perfect. I don't like pop on types because they tend to pop off. I love the microwaveable aspect because when my baby's ready to eat, if I don't have some out defrosted already I just take off the top and nuke em. Big Plus.
customer_reviews.author: Nerual

customer_reviews.title: 4 star buy
customer_reviews.text: I used the product to store my daughters baby food. The only issue I have is the baby food leaking.. even though the lid is closed my baby food I found has leaked several times. But as long as your jars stay up right then you won’t have a problem.
customer_reviews.author: tunekwah

customer_reviews.title: containers used for dog food
customer_reviews.text: I used these to freeze dog food. I have a 7 lb miniature pincher. Her frozen food consists of raw beef, Sjourners dry vegetable food mixed with water and pumpkin. These containers provide just the right serving for a small dog, 2x a day. The containers have held up with no cracking or other signs of excess wear.
customer_reviews.author: sue

customer_reviews.title: Small? But maybe good size for baby food
customer_reviews.text: These are much smaller than what I expected but it’s good enough for baby food storage which it’s why I bought it for! :)
customer_reviews.author: Gi Lawlor

customer_reviews.title: Nice containers
customer_reviews.text: I need to eat no more than 2 oz. per meal. These little containers help me with portions and planning my meals. Good tool.
customer_reviews.author: Loraine N Neal

customer_reviews.title: Versitile
customer_reviews.text: Bought these cups when DD was an infant in hopes of making her fresh baby food. We never really ended up doing the purees, but we use these still to this day (she is 4 now) as little snack cups for school and travel. Fill them all up early in the week with nuts, granola, etc and we can both grab them on the go. They screw on tight and don't spill. Stacking function is handy. Overall, a great product.
customer_reviews.author: RockabillyMama

customer_reviews.title: Actually bought these for seed storage
customer_reviews.text: And they're okay. All of the lids are at least somewhat screw top, but a number of them also seem to have a pop-on/off component. The screw feature seems to loosen sometimes, which has led to the occasional seed spillage. Also, the stacking pop in/out feature is neat, but only works some of the time. The containers seem to unstick from the tray a/o each other a fair bit, also leading to spillage. Also, one of my trays has somehow warped in the fridge, so its stacking feature has been mostly compromised. Capacity wise they work fine for my small seed storage needs, but they seem like they would be small for holding baby food.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: These little cups are great! I make a blender full of carrots (for example), fill all the jars and freeze them, then remove the frozen carrots to a gallon-size freezer bag and use the containers for another batch of food. Once I have a variety of baby food in my freezer, I can pop a different flavor in each cup for that day's meals. Tip: if you line the cups with plastic baggies, the frozen food pops right out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great item, a bit small
customer_reviews.text: This item is everything that it claims to be. I love that you can stack them on the little tray and on top of each other like lego peices. The only small issue is that they are a bit small. It depends on what you really want to store in them. For a new baby just starting to eat solid foods this is probably ideal or to store small parts of a meal for an older baby. I did see an option of buying these in a larger size, so maybe consider that.
customer_reviews.author: Holly M. Cameron

customer_reviews.title: I love that they stack and the cap is a twist ...
customer_reviews.text: I love that they stack and the cap is a twist instead of a snap. Makes me feel secure that the what's in them stays in them during travel.
customer_reviews.author: Achef

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Containers
customer_reviews.text: These work so much better than my baby bullet containers. I thought I would miss the little smiley faces, but instead I put some Name Bubbles (waterproof stickers with my daughter's name on them) on the jar and lids and they look so cute and are easy to keep track of at daycare or anytime we go out. These containers wash, freeze and stack well (both when filled and after washed). I would recommend them to any friend.
customer_reviews.author: EsMom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy to have found this product!! The screw-on caps are ideal - no more spills! They keep the food very secure in the freezer, too. I love the size of the jars, especially while my baby is slowly making his way into the world of solid foods. Now I don't have to waste food or space. I like to use them as little bowls, too, for when he's only going to eat a couple of spoonfuls of baby food from a jar.
customer_reviews.author: Kat Mills

customer_reviews.title: These work perfectly
customer_reviews.text: We make our own baby food and these are the perfect freezer containers for us. Each jar holds 2 oz. Make sure not to over fill them past the line provided, or the lid will not seal. A few lids have come unsealed upon freezing, but it is not a problem for us, as we use our stash up weekly. The stacking ability, and tray provided, are very handy. We are pleased with these, as they meet our needs perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Preeeeeetty Awesome =)
customer_reviews.text: These containers are great. The best thing is the screw cap that prevents leaks. Easily stackable (if that's a word) and doesnt take up a lot of space in the freezer. I should've bought more than 1 set. Just dont fill up passed the 2oz mark, frozen purees expand and will pop off the top. Wish they had more sizes 2oz/3oz/4oz...my son is at the 3oz stage so I've been using the freezing trays also.
customer_reviews.author: Punky

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Open
customer_reviews.text: We use these containers to store our supplements. Very easy to open and close. The see through containers let you know when it is getting empty easily.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Possibly a good deal if your are careful with the lids
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty good. The lids can be a bit fussy and hard to get on so that they stay on especially once the purées freeze but other than that they are what they are
customer_reviews.author: shhhh

customer_reviews.title: Might be perfect for my purpose..
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these because I expected them to be somewhat airtight - the picture shows them with liquid product inside. The first time taking off the lid, it felt tight but then it was easy on, easy off. I don't know how this works for people using it for baby food. I purchased them to store seeds for my garden. They may work perfectly well for my purposes but if you want to haul a liquid, you might want to bag it just in case until you have confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Reusable 2 oz Containers
customer_reviews.text: I had bariatric surgery, & these containers are great for taking to work. The lids screw on & stay on. The containers have a line at the 1 oz mark, so I can fill with only 1 oz of food easily, if I want. I haven't used them in the freezer, but I have used them in the refrigerator, & they've been fine. I've also washed them in the dishwasher several times already, & haven't had any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Very happy customer!
customer_reviews.text: We made all of the baby food that we fed our 4-year old daughter when she was a baby. At that time, we just used ice cube trays covered in plastic wrap. I was looking for a better system this time, and I think that these are the best option. They are super easy to use. The screw on cap is genius. It makes it so easy to take food with you when you are on the go. I plan on buying 1-2 more packs of these. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Alissa L. Shoemaker

customer_reviews.title: Love these!!
customer_reviews.text: These baby food storage containers are wonderful. I love how the lids screw on and they also stack nicely together. The tray fits perfectly on the door shelf in my freezer so I can stack the containers in a handy spot and they won't get lost in the packed freezer. I would recommend these to anyone who is going to be pureeing their own baby food. I am going to buy 1 more set of the 2 oz and also 2 sets of the 4 oz containers for when my daughter is eating larger portions. So far I think the 4 oz size is only available through the One Step Ahead catalogue, I haven't seen that size on Amazon yet.
customer_reviews.author: jmcquillan

customer_reviews.title: A must for making your own food
customer_reviews.text: These work great! The tops stay on in the freezer. Nothing gets freezer burnt. They clean easily and they stack pretty well. I just bought a second package so I can make more food at once. Some of my carrots did stain a one or two of them. I love how easy they are to throw in my diaper bag and go. Much better than some of the other types of food storage I own.
customer_reviews.author: Cathleen

customer_reviews.title: Indispensable
customer_reviews.text: These containers are made well, BPA-free and have relatively well-sealing lids. I used these to freeze baby food, to make my own servings of yogurt for daycare and to pack snacks like puffs and cheerios for travel and daycare. They stack, are dishwasher safe and are clear enough to see what is in them. For the price, a great value for moms and kids on the go.
customer_reviews.author: eiderdog

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: just as advertised. very nice product. I purchased the 2 oz cups and they were great but we quickly grew out of them. they are actually great for use with condiments if you are travelling and dont want to bring the entire bottle of condiment. as far as baby food, my daughter soon preferred larger amounts and the 4 oz cups were better. great screw top lids.
customer_reviews.author: JESS B

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: These are easy to use and so convenient. I fill them, put them in the freezer, and just pull them out as I need them. One thing, the top did come off one and the description specifically says that the top will not come off. Otherwise they have been great. They do not stain easily like other containers I've had and the easy stacking has been really great.
customer_reviews.author: JR Marx

customer_reviews.title: perfect size
customer_reviews.text: Love them. The lids are kind of hard to screw on, but they're perfect to put my frozen cubes of baby food in & send her off to daycare. So easy to throw in the diaper bag or take with you on the go. I have the 2oz ones too. Now that she's getting older & eating more, they're kind of small, so I got the 4oz ones also. I wish they were a 12 pack instead of 6.
customer_reviews.author: amazon bliss

customer_reviews.title: great buy
customer_reviews.text: I love the f&f baby food containers. Item arrived on time, works great. Only bummers were it does not qualify for super saver shipping (one of my fav things about amazon). If lid comes off when you take a container out of freezer you can't seal again until it defrost. So sometimes I feed baby something other than my first choice. Other than that it's my favorite item I've purchased to feed baby! (only thing I love more is my beaba baby cook)
customer_reviews.author: mrs. manrique

customer_reviews.title: Great little set.
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised when these arrived. The lids on all the small containers screw on (not simply press-on like gladware), which makes me very happy if I ever have to thrown these in a diaper bag. The little tray will fit perfectly on the freezer shelf or door and not take up much space. Excellent little system for managing homemade baby food!
customer_reviews.author: Christina Myers

customer_reviews.title: Easy to wash, don't topple over in the freezer
customer_reviews.text: If I had to do it again, I'd probably just buy baby food containers and then use those rather than buying these. They work fine but are a bit pricey for what they are. That being said, they don't fall over in the freezer and are reasonably easy to wash. No complaints about performance.
customer_reviews.author: Give It To Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: They are amazing! Very convenient and efficient. You can put anything inside; I use it for snacks, food, cereal, ect. You don't neceseraly need to freeze them. They aren't that big, and if you are going to use them for your baby's food, it must be when they are 6 months or less for the use of one, but if anything they can eat two at a time. I just love them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great if used properly!!
customer_reviews.text: I love making my babies foods and these are great, the perfect size/portion. My only complaint is that when you freeze them, they do not properly click together and occasionally the lid will pop off. The snapping together was a fun accessory but not important to me, however the lid must stay on. I've learned to flatten out any food that you plan to freeze so that the lid does not pop off. Also make sure to not fill past the 2 oz. line or the same happens. All in all, I really LOVE these!
customer_reviews.author: mom-o-4

customer_reviews.title: I don't use them as often as I thought I would
customer_reviews.text: I haven't been freezing much food. I just make it as I go & give the kids what we are having so I really haven't used these as often as I would like. I always had great intentions of freezing a load of food and having it on hand but realistically it is handier for me to do it on the go. They are good for portion size though. They might be better for someone who is more organised than myself!
customer_reviews.author: schmack82

customer_reviews.title: Cannot imagin leaving without these containers!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these containers for my baby girl's solid food. I am a busy working mom and makes her solid food on the weekend and freese the food in these dontainers. The size is just perfect for one portion and great for freezing and a microwave. I recommend these for a busy working mom who wants to feed her baby with homemade solid food.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Erpelding

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING PRODUCT!!
customer_reviews.text: THIS PRODUCT IS AWESOME!!!! I love the stacking feature and they are the perfect size for baby's food portions. Also travel really well due to the small size of the container - it is easy to travel with baby's food. The screw lids are great as they don't pop off when put into a diaper bag for transport. I recommend this product so much that I placed an initial order for one package and have come back to order more!!
customer_reviews.author: Rena H.

customer_reviews.title: Obviously designed by a parent!
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for freezing or toting food with you! The screw-on cap ensures no spills and the stacking design keeps things together in your bag or the fridge/freezer. Also like the 1 and 2 oz. measurement lines on the container. One lid arrived cracked, but I got prompt and excellent service in replacing the item. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: laurab

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE, LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE, LOVE , LOVE those Fresh and freeze baby food containers ! Very smart desing ! Planning on buying more ! Thanks !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good!
customer_reviews.text: I like these little containers. I use them for homemade hummus. Much more realistic size than the little 2oz. These lids are a little dodgy - like a half thread screw on - but can be popped off too since the screw is so shallow. Best part is they attach to the tray so they don't topple over.
customer_reviews.author: BREA

customer_reviews.title: Game changer. The fact that they stack together is ...
customer_reviews.text: Game changer. The fact that they stack together is so helpful as well.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Perez

customer_reviews.title: Tops did not stay on well
customer_reviews.text: The tops did not stay on these well, so I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: mdcherokeegrl

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love the containers! It's not the flimsy plastic so I don't feel like they're going to warp and bend. Nothing leaks out of the twist tops, I did my little experiments by putting water in and shaking it really hard. Have not pt it in the microwave, I'm not really for tupperware microwaving. One down side is that you really need to press the containers into the base for them to snap on. It hurts the palms a bit from the pressure.Other then that one little flaw, it's great! It attached easily to other containers and it does stay locked.
customer_reviews.author: Matti

customer_reviews.title: TOO small...WAY too small!
customer_reviews.text: Other than being WAY too small (it takes two or three of these per meal), they're pretty good. They freeze well, etc. and don't leak (so far!). They are a pain to fill too b/c they're so tiny, so I lay down a flour sack b/c it gets messy. I've switched to the small rubbermaid containers w/ the reddish lid. They do everything this does (stack, don't leak, etc.) but they're an actual serving size. The opening is bigger and easier (mess-free) to fill. I also like that I can snap the lid on the rubbermaid ones, right out of the dishwasher, so I'm not always looking for lids as I am with these.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Powers

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad
customer_reviews.text: This worked pretty well but the only issue that I had sometimes is that sometimes when it's frozen, the lid will pop off when you go to take it out of the freezer. Otherwise it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: DCM

customer_reviews.title: They seem fine with nice stacking lids
customer_reviews.text: They seem fine with nice stacking lids. I was hoping for a more pliable material than what these are made of. These are very durable. i use them for soil samples and they can take my abuse
customer_reviews.author: Eric S Geisler

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have For HomeMade Baby Food
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing and using 1 set of these I immediately purchased another set. They are Must-Have for homemade baby food. They are VERY easy to clean, easy to store, because they stack into each other and are perfect to feed the baby from. Too small to grab and perfect to manage in one hand. A purchase you will not regret!
customer_reviews.author: J. Snoz

customer_reviews.title: Crappy product. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: These leak terribly, and are worthless. I saw good reviews for them, but I can't imagine WHY. More food ended up in the bag holding them than in the containers. on a scale of 1 to 100 I would rate them a negative 10. I would not buy these if I were you.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer01

customer_reviews.title: It's not Dish Washer Safe!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these containers based on the reviews. Beside the fact it took too long to be delievered, more than 4 of them are loose, and can't be fully closed. My wife was washing them on the "UPPER" rack in the dish washer as the instructions said, and yet we found one of them with "MELTED" bottom. I don't know how this happened but we're very disappointed in the item. ***UPDATE*** I just called the customer Service, and they're so nice and offered me another set to try. Hopefully It'll work.
customer_reviews.author: Mohamed Elsherif

customer_reviews.title: SERVE A GOOD PURPOSE FOR BABY FOOD AND BEYOND!
customer_reviews.text: These worked perfectly with the Baby Chef baby food maker! I made so many types of baby food and it was so much fun! These are the perfect accompaniment to that machine as they are the perfect 2 oz size for those little appetites to start! After we moved onto table food, these little jars work great for just about anything else, food or non-food items!
customer_reviews.author: JAMIE PROVOST

product_meta.title: Fresh N Freeze 2 Ounce Reusable Baby Food Containers 12-Pack
product_meta.description:
Size:2 OunceOne Step Ahead has been making life easier, safer and more fun for parents and kids for more than 25 years. When they cannot find a product that meets their high standards, their in-house design team works closely with parents to develop ingenious, high quality products that are at least "one step ahead" of the competition.

Fresh N Freeze Reusable Baby Food Containers were designed by One Step Ahead to provide maximum versatility. Unlike cups with pop-off lids, the screw-on caps stay put in the freezer and the diaper bag. Freezer, microwave and dishwasher safe, so you can freeze, transport, and warm homemade baby food all in one container. Includes twelve 2 ounce containers that are stackable and snap together, and snap into the included storage tray, thanks to recessed hollows in the cups, lids, and tray. For easy portion control, baby food containers are marked in one ounce increments.
feature_bullets: The most versatile baby food storage containers available; screw-on caps stay put in the freezer and diaper bag, unlike less reliable pop-off caps
Includes twelve 2 ounce reuseable containers and a handy storage tray; containers and tray snap together thanks to recessed hollows in the cups, lids, and tray, for space efficiency in your freezer
Safe for use in the freezer, the microwave, and the dishwasher, allowing you to freeze, transport, and warm baby food all in one container
For easy portion control, baby food containers are marked in one ounce increments
BPA and phalate free, making them safe for use with babies; even use them for making perfect homemade popsicles

specifications.Material free: BPA Free, Phthalate Free, Latex Free, Lead Free
